intro: Brachyscome dichromosomatica, commonly known as the two-coloured daisy, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that typically display a striking contrast between the white petals and the dark purple central disk. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy, narrow leaves that help it thrive in arid conditions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Brachyscome dichromosomatica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
